meanings.definition: To build or construct something vertically.
meanings.sent1: The workers were erecting a new building in the city.
meanings.sent2: They are erecting a fence around the garden to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent3: The children were erecting a fort out of blankets and pillows in the living room.
meanings.sent4: She was erecting a wall of emotional protection around herself.
meanings.sent5: The artist was erecting a masterpiece with paint and canvas.

meanings.definition: To set up or establish something.
meanings.sent1: The team was erecting a tent for their camping trip.
meanings.sent2: They are erecting a new rule to improve safety in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The students were erecting a study group to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent4: He was erecting a successful business from the ground up.
meanings.sent5: The community was erecting a monument to honor their history.

meanings.definition: To cause something to stand upright.
meanings.sent1: The wind was erecting the flags on the poles.
meanings.sent2: She is erecting the umbrella to shield herself from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat was playfully erecting its tail while chasing a toy.
meanings.sent4: His words were erecting doubts in her mind about the decision.
meanings.sent5: The magician was erecting a card tower with precision and skill.
